intro: Hoffmannia confertiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered hoffmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and prominent stamens. Hoffmannia confertiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
